alert.note: Alert for Langlade; Lincoln; Marathon; Portage; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 18 at 6:16PM CST until February 19 at 6:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Marathon, Portage, Wood, Langlade and Lincoln Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Rapid reduction in visibility is possible, especially in open areas and along north-south oriented roads. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
